column6: Hi// how was your experience in the ward
column9: I am surviving the hell shift

column6: GOOD TO HEAR THAT!
I THOUGHT U SAID YOUR SHIFT WAS GOOD
Hmm... I don't think there's anything for me to do here...

column1: Occlusion Minigame Dialogue - Closed Roller Clamp
column6: Oh no! The BBraun infusion pump is emitting an error. Let's go and resolve it :D
To fix the alarm// it is good to check the error message shown on the BBraun Infusion pump.
Remember to mute the alarm// as it can cause distress to the patient.
When the infusion pump shows this error message// it usually means that the roller clamp is closed. Let's go fix that now.
Click on the back button and find the roller clamp.
Good job! Now that the issue is resolved// lets go back and restart the pump.
When the infusion pump shows this error message// it usually means that something is blocking the flow of the infusion tube.
There are many reasons why this could be happening// such as a kink in the line// wrong 3 way tap configuration// phlebitis// or a clamped t-connnector.
Let's go and check all of them to find the source of the issue.
Yay! We resolved the issue! However// we should still see if there are any other issues.
The alarm is very annoying// can you please deal with it? I'm trying to sleep here!
It seems the line is kinked// which is causing a pressure buildup. Let's smoothen this line out to resolve this issue.
It seems that the T-connector is currently clamped// which is causing a pressure build up. Let's unclamp this to resolve the issue.
It seems that the threeway tap is currently not in the current position// which is causing a pressure buildup. Let's turn this to resolve the issue.
It seems that the skin is very red and swollen. I should clamp the t-connector and tell a senior nurse.
Good call! The skin is very red and swollen. Let's stop the IV drip now.
The skin looks fine// I guess...
We will need you to set up a peripheral line for this patient.
Before you start// remember to check the patient information. You can do that by clicking on the clipboard at the top.
To begin// we need to set up the requisities to spike the IV bottle.
You can start to prep by removing the foil from the bottle and clean with an alcohol swab.
Click on the tray to access your items.
Click on the Infusion bottle to remove the foil.
Drag the alcohol swab onto the rubber hub of the bottle to cleanse it.
Good job! Now that the bottle is prepped// you should prep the IV tubing as well.
You can start by clamping the roller clamp. Then// you should remove the protective bag.
Once both steps are done// we can now spike the IV bottle.
Like I told you just now// you have to clamp the roller clamp.
That's the orange thing on the tube.
To spike the bag// we need to remove the protective cap.
Okay! All the preparatory steps are done// so you can spike the IV bottle now.
To spike the bag// we need to drag the IV tubing to the IV bottle to combine them.
What are you doing? Why are you unclamping the spike before you have primed it?
Please clamp the spike before you continue...
Okay! I've spiked the bag// so I am going to hang it on the stand now :D
Nicely done! We just need to prime the line now.
If you recall// we need to squeeze the drip chamber and open the roller clamp to prime the line.
You should squeeze the drip chamber to prime the line.
You should unclamp the roller clamp to prime the IV tubing
There is liquid on the other end of the tube// so it is sufficiently primed.
Nicely done! We can start up the B Braun machine now.
We should not open the door until we have primed the line// otherwise the alarm will sound if left idle.
Press the buttons on the BBraun machine to open the door.
Drag the parts of the infusion pump into the machine.
Good job! Now that we have added the infusion tube into the pump// we should input the parameters for the pump.
I don't think the parameters are correct...did you input them correctly?
Remember to check the patient information carefully.
Okay! I added all the parameters for the pump.
Good work! Before we can start the pump// however// we need to connect the pump inside the player.
Remember// you need to wipe the clave// then prime the IV plug// and finally add the IV tubing.
Firstly// you need to wipe the clave. It can be accessed in the patient view.
You need to flush the IV plug to ensure that there are no air bubbles.
Plug the IV tubing into the IV plug.
Remember to start the pump!
What Should i collect?
Look at the list at the bottom left corner!
Good job! You Collected Everything!
We dont need that.
We have enough of those.
Can you help me collect the prerequisite for CVL set up?
Thank you!
Hey! I want to take a shower//can you help me unplug my CVL tube?
column9: Sorry but you have to shower with it

column6: You are not suppose to take it out!! Now we have to set up a new CVL line//go back and collect the prerequisite again!
oh ok
Good job!! Always keep in mind that you shouldn't take CVL out

column1: Stoma Bag Deflation - Regular mode information
column6: Welcome to the stoma bag deflation tutorial!
In front of you// there are 3 patients with stoma bags that will slowly inflate. Monitor the patients and release the air when necessary :D
I'll set a timer for 3 minutes. Remember not to press on the bags too hard! I'm here to help you if you need it.

column1: Stoma Bag Deflation - Fail Case - Leaving halfway while the bag is open
column6: I probably shouldn't leave until i'm done releasing all the air from this.

column1: Stoma Bag Deflation - Bag not ready
column6: Okay// I think the bag is not that full yet.. Let's wait a bit longer.
The bag looks full enough! Let's deflate it now// shall we?
Time's up!!
Set up a Sterile field to prepare for CVL Set Up.
Firstly // prepare the sterile field and proceed to open the sterile items
Make sure nothing Unsterile goes into or across the sterile field. Inform me if anything goes wrong! Good Luck!
oh no! it is not sterile now!
what should I do now?
Why did you call me? Stop wasting my time!
Uh oh you need to collect the prerequisite and set up again!
Great! All the items are in!
Get that away! Its not suppose to be here!

column1: 6 Stoma Bag Deflation - Regular mode information
column6: Welcome to the stoma bag deflation minigame!
In front of you// there are 6 stoma bag that will slowly inflate//it is ready to deflate when the bean is on it. Remember to do it quick or the bag will explode!
I'll set a timer for 3 minutes// deflate as many bags as possible. Remember not to press on the bags too hard! I'm here to help you if you need it.

column1: 6 Stoma Bag Deflation - Bag not ready
column6: Okay// I think the bag is not that full yet.. Let's wait a bit longer.
The bag looks full enough! Let's deflate it now// shall we?
Time's up!! Good job!
All the bag has exploded!
